data.event: An elderly husband and wife were found dead Monday night in their downtown Hanover condominium in an apparent murder-suicide, authorities said yesterday.
An elderly husband and wife were found dead Monday night in their downtown Hanover condominium in an apparent murder-suicide, authorities said yesterday.
Yesterday, authorities released few details and said they were awaiting results of autopsies conducted by the state medical examiner's office, which should be released today.
Authorities did say that soon after arriving at the condo Monday night, it was determined that only the Lewises were involved and that the public was not in danger.

event.title: were interviewing the Lewises' neighbors and relatives yesterday

data.event: Authorities said they were interviewing the Lewises' neighbors and relatives yesterday.
One of their sons, Spencer Lewis of Bethel, Vt., declined to comment yesterday when reached by phone.
"I am beside myself right now," said Spencer Lewis, a local singer-songwriter.

event.title: had lived in the building for about 10 years

data.event: The Lewises had lived in the building for about 10 years, Giaccone said.
